triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Twitter is the primary social media platform whose data services (Streaming API and Firehose) are being compared in this study.

triples.name: API
triples.relevance: Application Programming Interfaces enable programmatic access to Twitter's data, specifically the Streaming API that samples tweets.

triples.name: Tweet
triples.relevance: Tweets (short messages with 140-character limit) are the fundamental data units being collected and compared in this study.

triples.name: Microblogging
triples.relevance: Microblogging describes the core activity on Twitter that generates the tweet data analyzed in this research.

triples.name: Social media
triples.relevance: Social media is the broader domain in which Twitter operates and to which these findings about data sampling representativeness apply.

triples.name: Sampling
triples.relevance: This paper proposes a novel methodology for evaluating sampling representativeness by comparing sampled API data with complete Firehose data.
